themes.label: Contracts and Private Legal Acts
themes.rationale: The inscription contains explicit legal terminology related to leasing (misthosis), inheritance (kleronomia), and testamentary dispositions (diatheke), indicating a formal legal agreement or foundation.
themes.quote: μισθ[------------------------------------- παραχ]ωρε [ν] ... κληρονομ α μου ... διαθ κης

themes.label: Accounts and Financial Records
themes.rationale: The text records financial obligations, specifically the payment of rent (phoros) and specific monetary amounts in silver denarii.
themes.quote: ε σ [νενκε τ ν φ ρον ... δην] ρια ργυρ ω

themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The mention of a 'dogma' (decree) of the 'demos' (people) suggests that this private arrangement was ratified or governed by a public resolution of the city.

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The legal arrangement is explicitly linked to the sanctuary of Zeus Labraundos, indicating that the property or the endowment was under the protection or jurisdiction of the temple.
themes.quote: ν τ ερ το λ[αβρα νδου δι ς]

rationale: This inscription from Labraunda is a complex legal document, likely a lease or a testamentary foundation established by a veteran named Aristius. It details the transfer of property, inheritance rights for descendants, and financial obligations (rent in denarii) to the sanctuary of Zeus Labraundos. The mention of a public decree (dogma) and the involvement of city magistrates (archontes) and the council (boule) indicates the official nature of this private-public legal arrangement, typical of the Roman Imperial period in Caria.
